intro: Echium acutifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf eveningprimrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Echium acutifolium is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
